channel.title: ML Engineering Blog
channel.description: Recent content on ML Engineering Blog

item.title: Rich Content
item.description: Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.

item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Math Typesetting
item.description: Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.

item.title: About
item.description: Grew up in Siberia, Russia, I entered Novosibirsk State University to study fundamental physics. During this time, I found machine learning to be an interesting subject and a hobby. Then I started working as an NLP data scientist on a chatbot project in a fintech company. My R&D department also conducted experiments and developed credit scoring models and marketing ML models. Throughout the years, I’ve studied and worked in multiple branches of Data Science, including recommender systems while working at Zvuk, a Russian audio streaming service, and MLOps engineering during almost two years of experience as a technical consultant at GlowByte Consulting.
